title: Meaning of this Symbol. Symbolologists
content:
Anybody know the meaning of this image, or just the idea of two branches crossed?

Would help much, thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture-1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture-1_0.gif) | 4.91 KB |
author: michaelcina

comments.content:
Does it have to do with the crossing of olive branches? A symbol of peace?

In the original Olympics, the winner was awarded an olive branch.  
 [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olive\_branch](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olive_branch "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olive\_branch")
Yeah, Matt Desmond said the same thing. I think you are probably right...

Yes, [Jeremy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/www.behindthename.com/php/view.php?name=jeremiah) Mickel, I suggest it can be related to the _[Palm (Branch) Sunday](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palm_Sunday)_, Jesus’ entering Jerusalem ( [John 12:13](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/www.blueletterbible.org/kjv/Jhn/Jhn012.html#13)).

[http://www.salsa.net/peace/symbol/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/www.salsa.net/peace/symbol/index.html "http://www.salsa.net/peace/symbol/index.html")

Was using it for a symbol for marriage, didn't know if I was going to be WAY off or like it secretly meant something when you crossed them, heh.

I searched for information about the same symbol a while ago, there is a lot to be found on the internet, for example; [Olive branch on wikipedia](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olive_branch).

It could also be a laurel wreath, representing victory/superiority.

Wikipedia may just add to the confusion  
 [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laurel\_wreath](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laurel_wreath "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laurel\_wreath")

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wreath](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020025902/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wreath "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wreath")

Tim
